reviews.review_msg: Karl was one of the best teachers you can have at SFU, even though his lectures were really long and gets out of the topic as long as you stay on track with his course outline you'll be fine! One of the teachers that I would always wanted to have class with.

I enjoyed reading the textbook and the course material was very interesting. He is a really nice professor and the amount of work required for the class was fair. I found it to be a pretty easy class. I found I would start getting restless partway through the class (it was 4 hours long in the evenings). He has a very mellow tone. But he was easy

The lectures could get a bit dry at times. People were actually leaving at the first break because of this. No feedback on the biweekly assignments, which I would have preferred. Other than that, Karl gives great opportunities to speak in class and likes to hear from other perspectives.
Nice,  easy to understand prof.  Midterms/exams are easy.  Easy essays (maybe the course is just easy...).  But doesn't complicate things and makes sure u know the basics.

A very good professor when compared to SFU newly appointed ones. Course readings are at an acceptable level and not overloading his students. He encourages Q&A and discussions during class and will explain to students when new terms are used/introduced during discussion by students. He listens attentively to foreign students and help them to suceed

text is from 1994, based on 1981 survey & has not changed as evidence by previous notes in library copy. Remember Cdn Charter not until 1982 yet 1 of the course topics is "gender" (not really; just women in workplace) & another, 1997 immigration of Chinese to Canada.....what the hell?!  This guy can't even answer Q's w/o quoting the outdated text.
He is a excellent professor and I found him to be very helpful and insightful with the material that he distributed for this course. I also think that he's handsome..nice on the eyes.

She is one of the kindest and passionate profs I have seen in SFU for a while. She genuinely cares about her students and accepts every opinion during the class discussion. I really feel she is under-rated and more students should take her class to understand her perspective. I would love to take another class with Deborah again!

I personally found the class to be boring. Assignments were not explained properly and the notes were mostly just pictures. Her marking was very subjective, making it difficult to write my papers exactly the way she wants.
